CatDescriptText: Portions of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1953, pg. 27, read: "Uptown Little League Opens Friday Evening - Dodger Players to Take Part in First Game Ceremonies - After months of preparation Little League baseball comes into the Hill District Friday evening when four teams, between the ages of 9 and 12, take part in ceremonies that will inaugurate the Uptown Little League.  As and added incentive for the opening ceremonies Jackie Robinson, Roy Campanella, Joe Black, and Jim (Junior) Gilliam, all members of the Brooklyn Dodgers, will take part in the opening game festivities...  Before arriving at Kennard Field where the first game is scheduled to begin at 6:30 P. M., members of the Little League teams along with the Brooklyn Stars will ride up the parade route..."
TitMainTitle: Marching band and majorettes on Kennard Field for Uptown Little League baseball opening day ceremonies
